<Text: Harristown, County Kildare:  It was formerly a borough and manor, and Harristown Borough was a borough constituency sending two MPs to the Irish House of Commons before the Acts of Union 1800.>

<Text: Harristown, County Kildare:  The borough was a rotten borough with "not one house and but one tree inhabiting".>

<Text: Harristown, County Kildare:  In 1837, Samuel Lewis described Harristown as "an inconsiderable village", though there was an Irish Constabulary barracks there.>
